intro: Catoblastus maynensis, commonly known as the Mayan catoblastus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
